title: In The Drops: Canyon Signature Pro kit, Condor Italia RC, Le Col Wiggins jersey, Posedla Joyseat saddle and Feel Good Club
content:
Cyclist
In The Drops: Canyon Signature Pro kit, Condor Italia RC, Le Col Wiggins jersey, Posedla Joyseat saddle and Feel Good Club

While we normally start our In The Drops with a witty Friday fact or fun anecdote, this week it only felt right to take a moment to remember Gino Mäder who tragically lost his life after an accident during the Tour de Suisse last week. It’s a stark reminder that life can be very short and our thoughts go to his family and loved ones. Many fans have been paying tribute by donating to environmental charity Justdiggit, which he championed and raised money for, Justdiggit has pledged to dedicate a regreened area to Mäder with the funds raised.

On cyclist.co.uk this week, our own Emma Cole has been valiantly crusading onwards atop her two wheeled steed towards her final destination in Tunisia. Now in Italy, she has given us a few insights into what gear has and hasn’t been working so far as well as how she’s managing to stay motivated on her epic voyage. The trip looks phenomenal and I am incredibly envious.

Will has been listening to the new BBC podcast about Marco Pantani and gave us his thoughts, and Sean Meager highlighted the senselessness of the UCI’s quest for a pin-less number system (spoiler: one already exists).

The Fara F/Road got a glowing review as did the Moots Vamoots CRD – yes, we know the price is eye-watering – and we got the first few in what will be a deluge on mitts reviews to come in the next few weeks. I’ve discovered I would make a terrible hand model and that chipped nail varnish looks twice as awful on camera.

Now onto the main course.

Related Posts

‘Marco Pantani: Death of a Pirate’ podcast review

Win a POC helmet and sunglasses package worth over £330

Canyon Signature kit

More commonly known for its bikes, Canyon recently brought out its Signature Pro clothing. The range is designed for those after premium kit with a selection of bold colour options. I’m a fan of bright jerseys in particular and the Women’s Signature Pro is available in bright orange – as shown here – as well as lilac, blue, brown and black. The jersey has a race fit, with raw cut sleeves and reflective detailing.

The seamless construction is carried over to the Signature Pro LTD bib shorts which also have soft straps and smooth leg grippers. The bib shorts are made from Canyon’s Push+ technical fabric, which it says has high sweat-wicking properties and is paired with Exteondo’s Urraki chamois for quality comfort for long days in the saddle.

  • Buy now from Canyon (£121.95)
  • Check out the whole Signature Collection

Condor Italia RC frameset

I’m currently doing a long-term test on the Shimano 105 Di2 groupset and Condor kindly lent us this Italia RC to build it on to. The Italia RC disc is a lightweight race bike made from Condor’s 7000 series aluminium, with a straight-bladed carbon fork.

There’s clearance for up to 30mm tyres and cabling options for both mechanical and electronic groupsets for versatility in set-up. It’s got a threaded bottom bracket, which I think is hugely practical – though there’s an ongoing office debate between Sam and Matthew on the merits of press vs threaded BBs – and is available in Midnight Blue or Black.

  • Buy now from Condor (£1,199.99) RRP £1,299

Le Col Wiggins jersey

My passion for cycling was fully kindled by Herne Hill velodrome, so too for many other riders including some guy called Sir Bradley Wiggins. The former World and Olympic Champion has teamed up with Le Col to make the Wiggins collection and this latest addition uses designs inspired by the curved lines of the velodrome where he started his career.

The Women’s Pro Aero jersey uses tripping fabric and a compressive fit, which Le Col says smooths the airflow around the rider and helps reduce drag. The Pro Collection uses work done in collaboration with the Bora-Hansgrohe pro team and aerodynamic experts at McLaren. Does it make me as fast as Sir Bradley Wiggins? I’ll leave that up to your imagination.

  • Buy the Wiggins Pro Aero jersey from Le Col (£160)
  • Check out the whole Le Col by Wiggins collection

Posedla saddle

Ever wanted a saddle that was specifically tailored just to you and your bum? Well Posedla can do just that for you with the world’s first 3D-printed made-to-measure saddle. You start by filling out a brief questionnaire, explaining your ride style, mileage etc to create a user profile, and this informs the build and shape of the saddle.

The fun part is sitting on the imprint box to get a bespoke outline of your behind, which Posedla then uses to create a 3D-printed upper tailored to you. The TPU padding sits on a carbon shell and rails, all of which Posedla says culminates in a ride that has ‘no pressure, just joy’. A perfect excuse to not lend your nice bike to anyone, eh?

  • Configure now at Posedla

What we’re into this week: Feel Good Club Instagram

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by Feel Good Club. (@wearefeelgoodclub)

I’m generally not one for mantras or positive affirmations but after stumbling across the Feel Good Club on Instagram a few months ago, my stance has been ever-so-slightly swayed. Life can be difficult, the world can feel dark and social media can often be a place of comparison or jealousy, so to have a dedicated pocket of positivity on a platform is a real breath of fresh air.

My favourite posts are the ‘Sunday Reminders’, which feature several different thoughts and, without fail, there’s always one that resonates and makes me feel a little bit better. It might sound silly but don’t knock it till you try it – it’s a genuinely lovely space and couldn’t we all do with a little more brightness in our lives?

  • Visit the Feel Good Club Instagram
